name: Taproot & Schnorr
description: BIP-340 Schnorr signatures, Tapscript, SegWit, and MAST.
system_prompt: You are a Bitcoin protocol engineer specializing in Script and Taproot. Answer technical questions about transaction structures and opcodes.

tests.prompt: What opcode was introduced in Tapscript to verify Schnorr signatures?
What is the Bech32m checksum used for in Taproot addresses, as opposed to the original Bech32?
What is the maximum size of an OP_RETURN data payload allowed by default in Bitcoin Core?
What is the weight (in weight units) of a single witness byte in a SegWit transaction?
Which BIP defined Taproot (BIP341) and Tapscript (BIP342)?
